section.title: Introduction
section.t: This is a package to convert memos written in XML to the RFC format.
If you don't want to install any software, you can use the web-based service.

section.title: Requirements
section.t: You need to have Tcl/Tk version 8 running on your system. Tcl is a scripting language, Tk is Tcl with support for your windowing system.
To get a source or binary distribution for your system, go to the Scriptics website and install it. If you get the binary distribution, this is pretty simple.

section.title: Next steps
section.t: Read the 2629bis document. In particular, Section 3 has some good information.

figure.preamble: A |*processing instruction| is a directive to an XML application. If you want to give directives to |'xml2rfc|, the PIs look like this:
The list of valid keywords are:
figure.artwork:
keyword default meaning ======= ======= ======= compact no when producing a .txt file, try to conserve vertical whitespace
subcompact compact if compact is "yes", then setting this to "no" will make things a little less compact
toc no generate a table-of-contents
tocompact yes if toc is "yes", then setting this to "no" will make it a little less compact
editing no insert editing marks for ease of discussing draft versions
private "" produce a private memo rather than an RFC or Internet-Draft.
header "" override the leftmost header string
footer "" override the center footer string
slides no when producing an .html file, produce multiple files for a slide show
sortrefs no sort references
symrefs no use anchors rather than numbers for references
background "" when producing an .html file, use this image
figure.postamble: Remember, that as with everything else in XML, keywords and values are case-sensitive.

section.title: Include Files

figure.postamble: |'xml2rfc| will consult the $XML_LIBRARY environment variable for a search path of where to look for files. (If this envariable isn't set, the directory containing the file that contains the include-file directive is used.)

figure.preamble: You can also have |'xml2rfc| set this envariable directly, by including a file called |".xml2rfc.rc| in the directory where your main file is, e.g.,
figure.postamble: which, on Windows, sets the envariable to a default value, and then inserts, at the front, the directory where your main file is.

section.t: There are links to various bibliographic databases (RFCs, I-Ds, and so on) on the |'xml2rfc| homepage.

section.title: Additions to RFC 2629
section.t: The |'artwork| element has an undocumented |'src| attribute that is consulted only if slides are being generated, e.g., The |'artwork| element has optional |'name| and |'type| attributes. The |'references| element may occur more than once in the |'back| element (e.g., for normative and non-normative references). Further, the element has an optional |'title| attribute. The value of the |'list| element's |'style| attribute can start with |""format "|. If the |'style| attribute of the |'list| element has either of the values |""hanging"| or |""format"|, then a second, optional attribute, called |'hangIndent| is consulted. For more information on these last two additions, see Section 2.3.1.2 of the 2629bis document for the details.

list.t: The |'figure| element's |'title| attribute is ignored, except when generating HTML.
When you performed Step 1, a folder in your |""Extensions"| folder called |""Tool Command Language"| was created. Create a new folder under |""Extensions"|, with any name you like.
Drag the file |"xml2rfc.tcl| onto the |""Drag & Drop Tclets"| application that was installed in Step 1.
When asked for an appropriate |"wish| stub, select |""Wish 8.3.4"|.
The |""Drap & Drop Tclets"| application will write out an executable version of |'xml2rfc|.
